title: Oil steady amid muted Thanksgiving trade and ahead of OPEC+ meet
text: Oil prices were steady on Friday in quiet trade with the U.S. Thanksgiving holiday underway, while investors awaited a meeting of OPEC and its allies next week that may result in the extension of a production cut agreement to support the market.

title: Stocks hesitate just short of new peaks as clouds darken over U.S.-China ties
text: Global shares ticked up on Friday, but hesitated to test an all-time peak as investors worried a new U.S. law backing Hong Kong protests could derail Washington's and Beijing's efforts to end their trade war.

title: A Stock Market That Offers Bulls Tasty Treats
text: Not that dogs are the arbiter of good taste; this cutie pie smacks her tongue at the thought of receiving a tasty treat. And so, the day before the Thanksgiving break, the stock market also smacked its tongue at the thought of receiving a tasty treat.

title: Wave of European Cannabis firms to list in 2020, analyst says
text: Up to five companies active in the cannabis industry could go public in 2020 in Europe, a continent whose stock markets have largely missed out on the North-American "pot stocks" frenzy, a leading industry analyst said on Thursday.

title: It's 'really unclear' what will happen at OPEC's December meeting: Argus Media
text: Azlin Ahmad of Argus Media says crude supply from non-OPEC producers could rise by 2.2 million barrels per day in 2020.

title: Answering The Important Questions: When To Buy Or When To Sell A Stock: Part 1
text: The methods I will be presenting are designed to help investors think their way through the research process and make sound fundamental decisions, rather than impossible perfect ones.

title: China reiterates its pledge to lower trade barriers, widen market access: Xinhua
text: China on Thursday reiterated its pledge to further widen market access for foreign capital and lower non-tariff trade barriers, as it aims to boost flagging trade amid a slowing economy and a trade war with the United States.

title: Stocks Slip With U.S. Futures On Fresh Trade Worry: Markets Wrap
text: Stocks slipped along with U.S. equity futures after President Donald Trump signed a bill backing Hong Kong protesters, raising concerns about the prospects for an interim trade deal between the.

title: BlackRock: Treasuries Still Have Role to Play in Asset Portfolios
text: Nov.28 -- Jean Boivin, global head of research at BlackRock, discusses the outlook for global central bank policy and how it impacts asset allocation.

title: Latin American Currencies Hit Record Lows as Drop Turns to Rout
text: Nov.28 -- Latin American currencies turned a decline into a rout this week, with three of the region’s most-traded bills hitting record lows.

title: World stocks stall as U.S.-China tensions flare again
text: A four-day rally that had lifted world stocks to near-record highs stalled on Thursday as a U.S. bill backing Hong Kong's protesters became law, provoking China's ire and threatening to  derail an interim trade deal between Washington and Beijing.

title: Oil falls for a second day amid rising U.S. inventories, output
text: Oil prices fell for a second day on Thursday after official data showed U.S. crude and gasoline stocks rose against expectations as production hit a record.
